WorkItem.Description:
Right-clicking in Rawr (i.e. the diamond in the gear list) does not bring up any Rawr menus, instead bringing up a browser submenu (with "Silverlight Preferences" and "Install Rawr onto this computer"). Behavior seems erratic, I remember being able to use the right-click a couple of times in Safari, but subsequent trials have failed. Have never worked in Firefox. Installed Rawr on both machines also don't work.
 
Home machine:
 
Mac OS 10.5.7
Silverlight 3 (3.0.40818.0)
Safari 3.2.3
Firefox 3.5.3
 
Office machine:
 
Mac OS 10.5.4
Silverlight 3 (3.0.40818.0)
Safari 3.1.2 (5525.20.1)
Firefox 3.0.14
WorkItem.Summary: [Base] Right-clicking does not surface Rawr menus in Firefox 3

Comments.Message: Nope, there's no right clicks allowed in Silverlight, unfortunately. You can left click on charts for the same effect, though. And for everything else, we'll probably add ctrl-click or something, but haven't yet.
I see! I didn't know that. Thanks! Ctrl+click would be good :D Thanks!
